titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the World Student Christian Federation Africa Region Records
World Student Christian Federation Africa Region Records
titlestmt.author: Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:20

did.unittitle: World Student Christian Federation Africa Region Records
did.abstract: The archives of the World Student Christian Federation Africa Regional Office include legal documents, minutes, financial records, and documentation of workshops and consultations dealing with issues such as human rights, women's leadership, conflict transformation, HIV and AIDS, and economic justice.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: World Student Christian Federation. Africa Office

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Deposited by the World Student Christian Federation Africa Regional Office, 2007, 2012

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World Student Christian Federation Africa Regional Office Records (RG 46D), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: WSCF was founded in 1895 with the aim of uniting movements or associations of Christian students throughout the world. The Federation is organized into six regions, each with its own regional office. The regions and the locations of their regional offices are as follows: Africa (Nairobi) Asia Pacific (Hong Kong) Europe (Budapest) Latin America and the Caribbean (Buenos Aires) Middle East (Lebanon) North America and Canada (New York).

The Africa Regional Office is located in Nairobi, Kenya and coordinates the efforts of 24 national movements across the continent. These national movements are called student Christian movements or SCMs. In addition to the SCMs, there are also several associate groups and organizations affiliated with the Federation through the Africa Regional Office. The organizational structure of the WSCF Africa Region includes the Africa Regional Committee (ARC), the Regional Executive Committee, and Sub-regional Committees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These are the official archives of the World Student Christian Federation Africa Regional Office. Many of the documents are available in both English and French. Series I contains legal documents. Series II contains minutes of the Africa Consultative Group, Africa Region Executive Committee, and Africa Regional Committee. Series III contains documentation of training programs and consultations sponsored by the Africa Region from 1987 to 2006, including on on human rights, women's leadership, conflict transformation, HIV and AIDS, and economic justice. Series IV contains financial statements dating from 1986-2006. Series V, Addendum 2013, includes material similar to what is contained in the earlier series, dating from 2008 to 2012.
